responses.rationale: The segment describes the mechanism of disease spread, not prices, economic data, or numerical metrics.
Reports a numerical metric ('23 states') using a standard verb ('shows').
Reports a numerical metric ('35,500 birds') using a standard verb ('confirmed').
The segment lists locations of cases, not prices, economic data, or numerical metrics.
Reports a numerical metric ('11.7 million turkeys') using a standard verb ('raises').
Reports numerical metrics ('46 million chickens') and economic status ('leading egg producer') using standard verbs ('is', 'had').
Reports numerical metrics ('13 million chickens and 305,000 turkeys') using a standard verb ('having to kill').
Reports numerical metrics ('22 million birds', '1.8 million', '1.9 million', '1.9 million') using a standard verb ('have had to kill').
Reports numerical metrics ('5.3 million hens and 88,000 turkeys') using a standard verb ('forcing the killing').
Reports a numerical metric ('56 percent') using a standard verb ('reported').
Reports a numerical metric ('one in five milk samples') using a standard verb ('announced its finding').
Reports numerical metrics ('at least one person', '36 dairy herds') using standard verbs ('confirmed', 'have been confirmed').
Reports numerical metrics ('22 million', '13 million') using a standard verb ('correct').
Reports numerical metrics ('22 million', '13 million') using a standard verb ('correct').
Reports a numerical metric ('at least 26 states') using a standard verb ('have been found').
